page.title: 06MAIDSTONE'S BUS SYSTEM
page.content: Bus routes in the centre of Maidstone are complex and circuitous, especially because of the one-way system. The bus station at the bottom of{Stone Street used to be the only terminal. The main information office and National Bus Company offices are found here. The construction of the{Stoneborough Centre saw the creation of a second terminal under the Centre's east wing. This has 8 stops, each catering for several services, mostly local. Many other town centre stops are used, especially close to the{High Street}-{ {King Street junction.}Less-local buses are routed from the old terminus, but some use both termini. All services are frequently held up by rush-hour traffic. Operation of these services may again be radically changed if the latest road building proposals are carried through.
